Changing my review to one star. I had an interview here and was told I'd be notified within the week if I got the job or not at their job fair this year. I was sent an email 4 months later saying they proceeded with other applicants. That is extremely unprofessional to not only host a job fair but not follow up with the applicant within the week after i called multiple times.

What if I had been depending on that job? What if I needed that job to help a sick relative?

You are what is wrong with America. America wants everyone to be working individuals with jobs but then we the people who want jobs are turned down by stingy management and not even told why we got denied the job.

Do you realize I don't even have a car? I was willing to walk in the rain 3 hours just to go to the interview. Name one person you guys hired willing to do that for you.

But forget us, right? We're disposable to you. You complain you need good help then you turn it down or get rid of them and don't even tell them.

You're freaking right i am angry and good reason, you turned down a hard working military veteran so you could hire some other scrub that will probably quit in 2 weeks after his first check.

text:
This company has been around for awhile and continue to hire new people. I never understood why they had such a high turn out until this year. The manager/owner has an absolutely terrible attitude with his staff. I don't care how cheap a business is if they treat the employees like this I will do my best to avoid them. I've personally witnessed his angry attitude while waiting to pick up my truck from a wreck. When you run a business your employees make it efficient. Without good employees you can't have a great business.

I wrote this for my grandpa, he is over 80 and asked me to help him.

name: Shirlee Bailey
text:
This company was used by my insurance roadside assistants. They said that because I had All-State insurance they were not putting me first because All-State doesn't pay well. That tells me that it's not about who is in need of help, but how our insurance pays them. I sat on the road for almost 6 hours with 3 kids.
When I called the place in which my car was to be towed, they said it was never delivered.
My vehicle was still sitting on the road even after I was sent a text saying it would be picked up at 4:37-4:52, only it was moved about 600 feet to where we initially stopped. The kids built a pyramid of rocks while playing in the ditch, which was approximately 600 feet to where the car was. Which tells me they loaded it then put it back down. WHY IN THE WORLD WOULD YOU DO THAT? Never again.

resp.text: This was on a very busy day, we told this potential client that we would get to her once we were finished with the calls that had come in earlier. She demanded that we get to her first and after some very uncomfortable phone calls we decided that we did not want to do business with said potential client. We informed the roadside insurance of this decision.

name: Michelle Smith
text: If you want to be talked over when trying to speak or talked rude to this is the company to use. I called them to explain something just like my insurance company asked me to do. Jason was very rude telling me I shouldn’t even be dealing with him only my insurance company should call him. First off its our vehicle and I’ll call all I need to about it especially when instructed to do so by my insurance company. I was belittled and talked to rudely. Our company will not use them again. We also requested our truck be dropped off at home 3 miles from the accident. He said oh no let me take it to my lot so the insurance company will come out faster. Which we let him do and it cost us $2800.00 because they didn’t come out faster and it sat there from 6/26-8/21. I’ll say the lady in the office was always nice when I spoke with her but Jason who I believe is the owner has no customer service skills. When someone calls to ask about their vehicle you should be willing to answer any questions they have and be nice about it regardless if they have their insurance company involved or not. Especially when you’re telling me a different story then my insurance adjuster told me minutes before I called you.

resp.text: This was not a issue on Ace Towing this was matter of insurance wasn’t notified properly, and when they did come we had to do what they told us to do, we strive daily to help and be reliable to ALL our customers. Thanks

name: J Brown
text:
Dozier brought to job site w leaking hydraulic fluid n rt track popping and flapping in need of a new sprocket we were told.  Another hydraulic line broke again 2 days later. The clacking got worse n louder.  The Dozier became harder to turn causing a slow down in work, additional time, labor hours, fuel, and double use of excavator to do Dozier work.  Finally, Dozier operator could not take the clanging noise nor fighting to barely turn Dozier and walked off the job Sun May 23, 2021 after struggling w Dozier for 5 days w no repair or replacement of it.
Also rental excavator started leaking hydraulic fluid at bucket on Sunday May 23, 2021 causing a shut down of operations.  Contacted United and 7:30 am.  No one responded till mid afternoon to replace hose. A couple of hours later hydraulic fluid leaking from same spot.  Called again around 4:30 pm.  Reluctantly, service man came back out.  It was discovered that he had not tightened the hose that he installed.  Hence the 2nd leak.

resp.text: Thanks, J. We have escalated to the local management team and hope to resolve the issue with you quickly. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to help in the meantime.

text: I'm not exactly sure what the deal is with this place. The lady in hardware is especially nice and knowledgeable. It's just hard to find anyone. No one seems to know where anything is, the lumber saw was broken, and just seems generally under staffed. Once I went in needing help finding a specific fitting for a pipe. There was a group of men standing there talking, and I couldn't really get any of them to help. I went to the customer service desk and waited for a page for about 10 mins. I just left. That was the first time that happened. Usually if you can find someone, they're extremely nice and helpful, but you have to hunt for them. Another time a fellow customer ended up explaining the tools I needed and where to find them because there was no one to be found. I don't really leave bad reviews, but this store needs more employees it seems like. And some serious help.

Like Home Depot - it is very extremely hard to get good assistance from store associates.  They are few and far between.  If or when you do finally get some assistance - they are extremely untrained for an area that they are not assigned to.

name: C Tuck
text:
If I could give zero stars I would!

So, in 2017, We had Lowe’s install new gutters with gutter guards (at their suggestion). We noticed that our roof above our front door has started to leak even more now, so we called our insurance about it. They checked it out, confirmed there was damage. Referred someone who could get the job done. Simple, claim stuff. The guy who is replacing our roof observed that the gutters were actually installed wrong and are causing water to sit on my roof AND rotting the wood underneath the shingles. LOWES will not do anything about it because of when they were installed and because they went through a contractor. SMH. Wish I’d known that before I bought all my bathroom remodeling supplies from them, I will no longer buy from Lowe’s. They have installed carpet in my house, through contractors before, I never thought I would have to go behind them and check accuracy and quality! I have my living room and kitchen that I am gettin ready to remodel, sadly I’ll have to shop elsewhere! I am a very DISAPPOINTED customer!

name: Jim Anderson
text:
Called before I drove 40 minutes to see if they had what I was looking for, Waited on hold for over 30 minutes trying to get someone to pick up the phone in the appliance department, never did pickup.
The Operator that I dealt with was very rude  and proceeded to tell me it was not her job to do anything but answer the phone.
Finally drove 40 minutes to the store and they did not have what I needed,it would have been very nice to have known that before I went.
I mean seriously I will try and never do business with these people again.

name: Cordelia Copelin
text: Great place stocked with all the beautiful flowers and anything else for your home.

name: Angela Hayes
text: Helpful and knowledgeable employees. Well stocked and returns are smooth and easy.

name: GA Cowboy
text: Very good variety of Flowers and garden materials. Easy check out and friendly employee's.

name: James Rice
text: I am continuously calling about a questions about a problem with my appliance delivery.  This is my 10th call today and NOBODY ANSWERS the phone in any department.  When someone did answer, I was placed on hold and then the phone dropped.  In fact, I have just been transferred by the 2nd person who answered and still, nobody will pick up the phone and my call was just dropped once again. What is going on here?   Very unprofessional.  Back to Home Depot.  Will try not to use Lowes and certainly not Fultondale ever again.

name: Sky G
text: I am a huge fan of Lowes as a whole, and typically have pleasant dealings in their storefronts.  I recommend you stay away from this location if you desire any sort of customer service assistance.  It is dismal to say the least. Maybe 1 in 20 employees understands what it takes to work in retail.

name: Anthony Seymour
text:
Staff was helpful until I had to cut my own lumber.

Cashier at the register almost freaked out when I pulled a 50 to pay for the lumber as she claimed she didnt have any ones.

You may want to work on that Lowes!!

name: The Diary of Bruce Adonis Dailey
text: I cant remember the lady with the short salt and pepper hair in the garden center name. She is an asset to the gardendale location!

name: Keith Davis

name: Yvonne Farley

name: Jeffrey Malone
text: Very hard to find help. And when I did find some they didn't know what they were doing.

name: Tisha Thompson
text: No matter the location, nor the state it is extremely hard to get assistance when in any Lowe’s store! Other than Ms Linda, who was so very helpful, when purchasing appliances, this store lacks in good customer assistance!

name: susan graves
text: Good people work there. Friendly and nice

name: Jennifer Dunn
text: It's great to have a one stop place  like Lowe's, however it's very hard to get an employee to help. I have had good service at in the paint department though.

name: Aimee Warren-Mitchell
text: It was extremely crowded. No assistance at the paint department.  Cashier upfront was kind.

name: Tisha Thompson
text: No matter the location, nor the state it is extremely hard to get assistance when in any Lowe’s store! Other than Ms Linda, who was so very helpful, when purchasing appliances, this store lacks in good customer assistance!

text: The 4 star is for the store not her. As a first time getting paint at that store,and a new customer, the lady behind the paint counter was Rude, not knowing what to do lines and the such, I waited and finally she said,  if you want paint go to that window she pointed, we told her  we in area didn't seem to change her attitude. Gave color needed and.finised shopping. Picked up paint , not realizing she left set paint on side of can. What a mess, didn't notice the paint, she should have. I never got paint from a store like that. It shows she doesn't care.

text:
Went to find some fall perennials and for the most part found what I was looking for.  It was labor day and I was surprised it wasn't really busy.  I had a list of plants I was interested in getting. Found all but one. Unfortunately help was as elusive as the plant was. Shree was our checkout person and she was very sweet and was only one working.  We purchased an item that she placed in a bag and I forgot to ask for it and Shree forgot to get it off the round.
Still a lovely day to go plant shopping.

The competition has a similar item, but is different in size. There will be a visible break, but can't be avoided. Sorry Lowes, thought I could depend on you.

To the guy who decline to help.. Thank you for allowing me to receive service from someone helpful. :) I hope you learn that customer service comes before stocking.

Can’t ever get anyone to answer the phone. Lowe’s website tells you to call to confirm if an item is in stock, what a joke! They operate without care because they are the only game in town. We need a Home Depot in north Birmingham. This is not a reflection of the employees. It is a reflection of the store manager. He exceeds store financial objectives purely because locals have no other choice. Competition would be a game changer!

I will continue to drive to Trussville Home Depot where customer service is first class.

When something is out of stock or it hadn't been restocked yet surely the employee working in the areas should know their areas well enough to know how to find it's temporary location or if it has been reordered within a reasonable amount of time without having to find several others just to ask how to find it. I could of done it myself on their website on my phone. So what is their presence for?  I'm all for jobs but paying someone to just work there only drives the cost up to customers.

It’s been a week and they still  don’t have the information.

I find that hard to believe.

text: A worker there had a attitude did not like her, I got some paint, was very rude,  left paint on the can, didn't wipe the can off it got on the cashier hand, she best be glad it didnt get on me, if she didnt want to be there she should have stayed at home, 🤨

name: Constance Watkins
text:
I paid for an upright freezer on 7/15/20. While in the store the clerk stated that they had 1 more left and that it could be delivered the next day.  I  waited from 8am to 8pm for the appliance.  When I finally got someone,  the appliance was not on the truck or in the store.
I was then told that it was ordered.   2 weeks  later another delivery day was set up.   By the end of the day, no freezer.      A month later received  a call and text message for next day delivery.   Again, no delivery.  By the forth call and text which was on a Sunday,  I  called the store and .o one would answer the phone.   Later that evening when I did get someone, still no product.    I called  the corporate office and complained.   I never got a call to apologize for my inconvenience. I spoke with the corporate office about getting my money back and was told the store could do it over the phone.   When I called and finally got someone to answer the phone. I  was told that I had to come in. When I got there, the clerk said they could not give me the money for the warranty.   At that point I  demanded  my money and the manager
The clerk walked off and someone else came and told me the manager was in a training meeting.  Considering All That I'd been through,  the manager should have come out.  He was the only one that could authorize the refund.   It took 2. Weeks to get my money credited back to my card.  I will never go to Lowes in GARDENDALE ever again
The service was horrible and management a joke.  If you are handicap this is not the store to go to.  90 days of lies and he'll is what I got.  Considering that the merchandise was paid for and my account FLAGGED TO give a phone call on updates, I received NOTHING.
VERY POOOOOR SERVICE.

name: Meredith Burgett
text: Went in to purchase wood for a bedroom and the sales associate was super helpful and made it a flawless process.

name: Leann Talley
text: If I could give no stars I would. Supposed to have a Refrigerator delivered on 4-22-2020, they called said the truck was down ok that’s fine was told I would get it the next day. I had to go to the store to find out what was going on because the can’t bother to answer phones was told I couldn’t get it till Sunday. Told them to give me my money back it was processed then they tell me it will take 7 days for my money to be back. NEVER AGAIN WILL I BUY ANYTHING FROM THERE

name: Pat Lively
text: One check out person at 1:15 on a Saturday with about 14 people in line. Self  check out wasn't any better. Several people just got out of line and left.

text: I ordered a curbside pickup. Yes it says to wait till an email is sent to pick it up but I was already  nearby, so I decided to wait. In the hour and a half I sat here.... 1 person was brought their pickup. If I saw more activity, I would understand but 1 in an hour and a half!!!

text: Great variety, great customer service, neat and clean.. They have a lovely assortment of plants and flowers

name: Stephen Brown
text:
I like this lowes. They have a great selection and they're conveniently located. Only problem is they almost ALWAYS have everything Kobalt up in top stock. And with the exception of 1 or 2 people, no one seems interested in looking for it. They just say "we don't have it". So I routinely go and find it myself, and ensure I go back to the same employee that didn't want to work, and tell them I found it for them. The look on their face is always amusing.

Other than never having their HOUSE brand actually on the shelf, I enjoy shopping here.

text: I was going to buy 2x10x12 pressure treated wood and needed to have it cut in half but they said since it was treated wood they couldn’t cut it cuz it messed up they saw and they didn’t have a special blade to cut treated wood lol, really i guess they need to call home depot to see if they sell blades for pressure treated wood...

text:
Have to say I wS pretty disappointed on this trip.  This store has gone way downhill in the past few months.  I went to the lumber department to price wood for a project. A full third of the bins were empty.  The sad thing is that what they did hqve out was in the wrong place!  2x6x10 where the 4x6x12 should have been.  All of it was like this.  It was impossible to tell what the price was on anything!

Throughout the store, asiles were blocked by pallet jacks or buggies, making navigation difficult at best.  To think I drove nearly an hour just to go here....

name: ANTHONY HAMILTON
text: Awesome customer service

name: Dr. D
text: I purchased a stove and everything that could go wrong did and with terrible customer support. First they never called me to confirm my delivery date of my product. I found it online which was a Monday. Well they showed up Sunday unannounced. Lucky i was there but unfortunately there was a dent. I called that day to Lowes Online Customer Support which stated someone will call me from the store that it was fulfilled to fix the problem. I called the store this time and they wanted me to uninstall everything and just give me a whole new one which i stated that I couldn't do that because i paid someone to connect everything which would mean that i would have to pay them again. She stated that they couldn't help me with that. I finally convinced them to just order the storage shelve that was dented and it would maybe take 2 months. At this point Im like whatever. They get me to Chris the appliance guy and he states that they have a whole unit in stock and they would deliver that shelve to me the next day. I was happy and ready to put this behind me. If only it was that easy. Chris stated that someone would call me the next morning to inform me of the time frame that day for delivery. They never called or showed up. That was Monday. I have been calling multiply time today to try and get this resolved but no one is answering their phone in the delivery department. Very frustrated and wish this issue would be fixed already

name: Layla Hening
text: Hit or miss if there is customer service available but nice store all in all

name: Marquis C Jones Sr.
text: Awesome experience today... I love it at this Lowe's

name: preston davis AL
text: Good store hours I can go in before work if I need something

name: Katie Malone
text: I recently purchased appliances for the first time from Lowe's. This was the worst experience I have ever had with a store - big or small. After multiple set up deliveries that never showed, I had to call the store, spend way too long on the call carousel, and ultimately had to take my complaints to corporate. When they were forced to call me back, I felt like my problems had been resolved, and my appliance would be delivered. The next day, I received an email that my fridge was ready to be picked up. After calling the store AGAIN, it was finally sorted out. I think I got lucky and spoke to someone who cared that it had been nearly two months of waiting. After the microwave with the original delivery didn't fit my space, Lowe's in Fultondale denied my return on day 57 of 60 with no reasoning except that their "policy had just changed." I will no longer shop at Lowe's. What a nightmare.

text: I went to this location to buy a washer, the guy in appliance was all over the place to busy to help anyone. I finally got his attention long enough for him to tell me they are sold out of washers. That they only had one left. Well I got the one they had. text: This Lowes really needs to work on their employee culture and overall customer service. Over the past several years, my husband and I have purchased several large appliances. All of which were a nightmare of an experience.  No communication about delivery and expectations once your item is paid for. No delivery confirmations/calls from the "warehouse". The first items were a washer and dryer and fridge - they showed up 2 days late. Frustrating considering we needed the items urgently AND we took time off to be there at delivery time. Most recent was a dishwasher. The man in the back who sold us the dishwasher seemed like he would rather be anywhere BUT work. Honestly, we would have walked right out if it wasn't for the fact that I had some rewards to use at Lowes. He gave no information and in fact, told me I should "search online and compare dishwashers" because he wasn't an expert and didn't have a say on any of them. Then we asked about delivery. He had no info - not even on the process and we explained we had a bad experience before. Instead of sticking up for or explaining to us that maybe it was a fluke, he went on to talk about the "warehouse" and how many complaints they get on them. Not very reassuring. Our dishwasher didn't show up today so we will be canceling our order and we just opened a Home Depot account - so Lowes, you have lost a customer.

name: Sir Consumer
text:
Today July 7, 2020, Lowe's in Fultondale seems to minimize the risk of Covid 19 by allowing patrons to opt in or out on a county wide mask wearing mandate. Sadly I noticed today and  just a few days ago the same practices. THE MASK should cover the nose and the mouth! It isn't a college or super intellectual level of comprehension. Air is taken in thru the nasal passage as well as by mouth.
Jefferson County is under a county wide mask required mandate. This is to protect everyone. This mandate is essential in providing some precautions allowing businesses to stay open. Why are patrons allowed to enter Lowe's without a mask?? No mask No entry.
Cigerettes and pets aren't allowed due to potential dangers and risk to others. Wearing a mask is no different. It provides some safety measures as the rules No Pets and No Smoking inside.

name: Brandon Adams
text:
Went to the local Lowe's to purchase some blinds.  I needed one to be cut to fit my window but left after waiting for an hour and never getting any help.  I asked multiple employees, went to customer service to get help, and even called them on the phone from within the store hoping to reach someone that could help.  No one ever came.   One employee did try to get someone to come help us but no one ever did.

This is not my first experience having extended wait times only to have no one come to help.  In addition checkout wait times are usually high when I have been as there are only one or two registers open.  Even when they see the lines building up it takes them so long to get another register open that it's pointless.

name: Melissa Thomas
text: My husband, a veteran and law enforcement officer, and I just left this location not even 10 minutes ago. We went in to return a work desk that he had purchased yesterday, only to come home and find out that pieces are broken and missing. When we arrived at the return desk we were greeted angrily by a lady named Shelia (her tag said CSA Front Desk). She was in the process of helping another gentleman with a wheelbarrow at the time we arrived so I shrugged her attitude off as frustration to begin with. By the time she got to us she took the receipt from my husband, asked angrily what was wrong to which he informed her that the desk portion (the main part of the item) was broken down the middle and pieces were missing. She rolled her eyes, mumbled a few things, then started to walk away and as she was walking into another room yelled back at us "you know it's a clearance item right?!"  She then came back out of that room, struggled to get the lid off the box and then continued to tell us in a displeasing tone that our kobalt work desk was on clearance. I then stated "so does clearance mean that pieces are broken? If so, lowes should not be selling clearance items". She then argued with me that clearance items are usually returns with missing pieces and I restated that the main portion of the item is completely broken in half. I don't care if it's clearance or not, it was not marked down nearly enough to compensate for a complete useless, damaged piece. She then slammed a refund receipt down and asked my husband to sign. She never asked if we wanted to swap it with a usable piece. She never asked anything, actually. During this entire transaction she was rude and everything anyone in customer service should not be. She was also complaining and cussing under her breath about no one answering the phone around there during our entire few minutes with her. When we were leaving there were 2 more men waiting patiently behind us and just staring in disbelief at what they witnessed and would unfortunately encounter. I told one man good luck as we walked off and he said it looked like he needed it. Needless to say, if lowes in fultondale is going to hire individuals of her caliber, we will not step foot back in that store and may in fact just take our business to Home Depot.

name: JohnDoe Beats
text: We went here to purchase cabinets, the process started on Nov. 21st 2016. We have spent over $20k in the past 6months. It took them four times to measure our kitchen correctly, also had a lady insult my fiancé in our own home. Finally when we ordered the cabinets a few weeks later, we were told it would take 30 days to get them in and possibly a week extra to get them installed. Two days before we were supposed to get the cabinets in we received an email from the man we was working with stating that he was sorry, the order was incorrect and said he was leaving that he couldn't help us any longer. Well 3 cabinets were missing, and was measured incorrectly...... AGAIN. Don is the assistant manager over there and is terrible. We met with him and got another person to come measure... again and said we had to wait another 30days before it could be here and another 1-2weeks to install. Well the installer said when they got here he couldn't finish the trim because something was not finished. Don has told us from the start that we would sit down and discuss what needs to be done to make this right. I have called lowes 20 times and got Don at least 10 and said he would call me back. HE NEVER DOES. I have asked for the store manager Jeff left messages, still no answer. We have been dealing with this for 6 months and spent a lot of money for a normal person. LOWES IS THE WORST STORE, MOST OF THEIR EMPLOYEES ARE RUDE AND HAVE NO CUSTOMER SERVICE ABILTIY AT ALL. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND LOWES TO ANYBODY EVER.

text: We recently purchased a Lawn mower from Lowe's and used it 2 times and then it started sputtering and smoking and would not crank. name: Bruce Hartman
text: Great customer service. Prompt installation. Courteous employees. Would definitely recommend this company to others.

name: Trevor Neville
text: Where I work.

name: Joseph Bieker
text: I have worked here for going on 6 years now . I love my job . I am a lead man/supervisor over the mill . Great place to work for . If you do your job then they will do their best Not to lose you. People in office really care about the workers . They offer competitive pay , 401k , paid vacation , life insurance , medical , dental and vision . Just stop by and put a application in .

name: Isaac Prichard
text: Easy to find and really fast at unloading

name: Steve Semar
text: Truck driver here.  Delivering wood from up north to this place.. pull in .  No signs.  Where I parked I was automatically berated by some short guy...napoleon complex. Here we go.  I drive 600 miles a day to keep this show running and this guy treats me like some homeless street boy.    Dont buy anything from this place.  Not American friendly.   The only person I have met from Alabama was this guy.  Yall know how to breed idiots down here.

name: Jason Orr
text: Need an appointment at this place to unload dont know there hours yet

name: Alex Kh
text: No overnight Parking!!! 4 stars because No overnight parking! Thanks forklifts guys who helped me with unload! Maybe need an appointment for unload!

name: Paul Charles
text: Had granite installed by Paradise granite  3weeks ago in a new home . When water gets on granite it turns dark. Was told by Haley at paradise granite it needs to be resealed and they didn’t do that,  I would have to do it myself. Why should a customer who had granite installed 3 weeks ago have to seal it. It should have been sealed properly to start with. No I don’t recommend them.

name: Pam Kell
text: A week without a concrete estimate but everytime the one I picked was sold. A month out to install but nice inventory. 50% down without a firm installation. Best price but still waiting for a firm date for installation. Sent me to Pensacola to find something they can order...we will see what happens.

name: Brook Hutchinson
text: So far so good. I had granite installed this week for a new home and had some problems with the craftsmanship in our kitchen. They seem helpful in getting it resolved.

name: Monika McGowan
text: Paradise Granite came highly recommended and they became a very bright spot in my otherwise disastrous reconstruction project.  Haley was so helpful and informative from the start.  I needed a granite reinstall and the first crew set my counters and found my backsplash was too high and took the pieces back to the shop for trimming.  The second crew came for reinstall of the backsplash.  Every one has been so nice and professional and helpful.  I will always use Paradise Granite and sending a shout out to Marcus, Sam, Douglas and Chico!  Thank you so much!

name: Alicia Harwood
text:
Great service and reasonable prices.

Mr. Motta and his team were very helpful when selecting the granite for our bathroom upgrades and the sinks that would work perfectly with them.

They did such a great job with our bathroom remodel project that we also contacted them when we had issues with our kitchen sink coming out of the granite that was installed at the time of building our home.

Their crew was always respectful and even helped to clean up the area both times after they were completed with the work.

If we find new reasons for granite, then we would definitely use their services again.

name: Monica kucera
text: Everything was perfect! Great selection. Mainly dealt with Micheal and Hailey, but everyone was super nice and helpful. Install was quick. Very happy! Highly recommend!!

name: Mike Binion
text:
For several years I have been thinking I wanted to update the countertops in my kitchen. I put it off because I thought it was too expensive. I thought it would be too big of a job. I thought i didn’t have time. Well, I went to the Elberta location and was greeted with a warm, friendly and professional staff. Haley and Crissy were very helpful, knowledgeable and willing to answer any questions that I had. The job was not expensive! The granite was installed in less than two hours. It fit perfectly and improved the entire house!!!
I don’t know what the return on this granite will be to the house but I can imagine it will be a huge increase in my home’s value.
I am happy to put my approval on this job.
Thank you Paradise Granite!!!

name: Heather Pollard
text: Cleo is really knowledgeable and helpful, found what I was looking for and the pricing is PERFECT

name: Jeromy B
text: Good selection. Great people

name: Bob Pace
text:
Dealing with Paradise Granite was a terrible experience. Their initial estimate for replacing our kitchen counter tops was acceptable, but the final bid was $1,400 higher due to their representative performing improper measurements. Our salesperson, which was very rude and defensive, refused to honor their initial estimate. We asked to speak to the manager three (3) times but he/she never called us.

On the morning of the scheduled installation our salesperson called and asked, “do you have a forklift at your house??? Paradise will need one to get the granite to your second floor” ...we were appalled!!! We asked to speak to the manager again, but never received a call. Paradise finally got the granite counter tops to the second floor without a forklift which were finally installed to our satisfaction.

Overall, we found Paradise to be inept, rude and condescending and would recommend that you do not waste your time!!!

Any response or commentary from management to this critique is not requested, needed or required since you did not have the courtesy of calling us back numerous times………………

name: William Marineau
text: Great experience, even though things didn't go as planned, they went above and beyond to make it right.  When the installers came to install the counters, the breakfast bar had been cut incorrectly.  They were scheduled to come out in 2 days to install the back splash, but called me to say they would come out the next day since it was their issue.  Overall, they did a wonderful job and the counters and back splash look great.  I think you can tell a lot about a company when they have to handle a problem, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Paradise Granite.  By the way, they also have fantastic prices.

name: Julie Stoner
text: I love the color of the granite I purchased. And I appreciate them hold it at their yard while the floor and vanity were being completed. However, I am a bit concerned with how the bathroom was left when the workers installed the countertop.  My home is not a construction site. It is my home and people live in it. The workers left a mess. I called and spoke to Chrissy and she stated the workers should pick up the larger pieces but the dust and dirt, no, since it is a construction site." Again, this was noy a construction site. It is my home. For me, had I known that cleaning up after installation was not part of the Paradise Granite customer service policy and considering the cost, I may have reconsidered my purchase and gone elsewhere.

name: Sandra Wilgus
text: Spent a lot of time trying to pick the perfect GRAY granite for my kitchen. Finally found the right piece. Took pictures of the slab with my floor tile next to it to be sure it matched.  Charged exact price quoted, installed on day promised. However, the granite installed is black and white. Not gray. When questioned they said since I didn't have a picture of the FULL slab, they couldn't compare what I picked versus what I got. Had I wanted black and white, I would have picked a different pattern than what was installed. Feel ill each time I think of it or see it. Trying to learn to like it...but feel ripped off.

name: Christopher Felch
text: Great company. I only contacted them in reference to getting a cut off piece of scrap to use as a pet memorial and they hooked me up without hesitation. Makes me wish I had some work to give them. I can only image how dedicated they are to helping paying customers.

name: BRIAN ARMSTRONG
text: Throughly enjoy working with the team at Paradise Granite.  They always have a great selection for customers to choose from and have an excellent staff that is extremely knowledgeable.

name: Stacy Tittle
text: We had the best experience with Paradise Granite. Having never purchased granite before, they made the experience effortless. Not only does our granite look amazing, it actually cost less than we thought. Having dealt with a variety of contractors in the last 6 months, I am so thankful that the granite experience was this easy.  I highly recommend these folks. Thank you PG!

name: Trasie Stelly
text:
Used Paradise for a remodel on a condo at the beach. My salesman was rude and tried to intimidate me over the phone when I talked to him about a crack in the granite. When my contractor called him about my issue Gus said that I told the other granite people that I liked the cracks!  Who liked cracks?!?!  Then he called me back and said I did say it. I don’t know one person who would say they like cracks.

When they showed up for install they said they were coming at 8, then 12 and finally showed up at 3:45. Condo rules say you must stop at 5 so they were kicked out for working past that. The next day again they showed up late and said they would finish by 5:45. We had plans at 6:15. They left at 6:10.

They are not reliable and very rude. Plan on remodeling the rest of the condo next year, I will look for another granite person.

name: Buddy Persons
text: hired these guys to do our house in innerarity point in Perdido key and they did a great job.  They were able to meet the schedule and prices were good.  There was a stain in some of the marble, they came out looked at ti and replaced it without question.  glad we used these guys....

name: Ron Quilhot
text: Friendly helpful and large selection of granite.

name: Cheryl McCoy
text: Fair selection but clerk did not appear to be knowledgeable

name: Kevin Brane
text: Very nice selection of granite.

name: George may
text: I contracted Paradise to install new tops for two bathroom vanities.  I was given a rough estimate until the measurements were precise.  I put a down deposit.  After measuring an exact price was given.  After the job was complete which was a little substandard, backsplash does not line up, the tops were not sealed and the worksite not cleaned up.  They did come back and cleaned/sealed the tops.  After that I still considered hiring them for my kitchen. I went by to pay the balance and was charged $253 over.  I contacted them about our contract and was told I would not get a refund.  They said they can not credit my card.  I would not recommend do to the dishonesty and substandard work.

name: Sara White
text: The end result ended up being fine, however, getting to the end result was a major pain. Everyday after the employees left I had to call the office to complain, and get them back out. The issues ranged from leaving large chunks of counter in my yard, to damaging our wood work, to chipped granite, to overall just sloppiness. they left their work area messy and I had chunks of debris chipping off my counters, I had to complain about multiple times before they totally removed it. Getting new countertops should be fun and exciting, not something that causes you a headache and you dread because you know theyll manage to screw something up....again. I have tried multiple times to speak with the owner in regards to my complaints,  and he refuses to speak with me. I'd advise anybody to save themself the headache, and go elsewhere.

name: John Pierce
text: Best selection.

name: Linda Leighton
text: Fantastic selection and prices of granite, marble and quartz.

name: Bob Webb
text: Prices were great, service was even better!

name: Joshua Purser
text: Multiple failures to return calls. Multiple no-shows and reschedules with no warning. Very poor granite, dirty, words still written on granite, no cleaning, no sealing. Probably the worst company I've personally dealt with. Not sure how they are still in business.

name: Marina M
text: Best Granite Shop in town!! Go check it out.

name: Bonnie Shearer
text: Best prices. Love it!

name: Dave Ebert
text: Did a nice job on outside bar

name: Simone Sobhi
text: Excellent

name: Ronnie Ridlon
text: Wanted to share my experience with United rentals in Foley Alabama. Absolutely amazing, every single person I deal with is awesome and extremely helpful! But I have to give the biggest thanks & Recognition to Sara Polansky! She is amazing, gets whatever I need no matter the hurtles. Always comes though with perfect service!  Great company and people I highly recommend them for anything you can rent.

resp.text: Thanks for the shout-out, Ronnie. We appreciate the feedback and hope we can help out again soon.

name: Jimmy Chivers
text: I always receive the best service when I rent a piece of equipment. The people are very helpful and friendly.

name: John Jr Blacksher
text: When I pull in the yard, I never have to wait more than a minute to get waited on. Got to keep my head on a swivel because someone will be coming soon on a forklift to get the trailer off or to unload my truck.

resp.text: Thanks, John. Looking forward to working together again soon.

name: Kevin Maxwell
text: Sales associate(Angie) from the Pensacola Branch has been a pleasure to work with. She always takes care of me and all rentals set up for delivery and pick up with no issues.

resp.text: Thanks, Kevin. We appreciate the positive feedback and shout-out for our team. We're glad we were able to help you with your equipment needs and look forward to working together again soon.

name: Tim Simpson
text: Great place to rent equipment, very friendly staff.

resp.text: Thanks, Tim. We appreciate the feedback and your business. Let us know if there's anything we can do to help in the future.

name: Jake Plash
text:
Nice staff, very knowledgeable. There is this one mechanic named Jon, he went out of his way to help my crew understand the machine we picked up. We asked every question possible and he never once brushed us off or got irritated with us(and it was hot out). You don’t get many people that are so knowledgeable and professional. We will come
back just for that one mechanic alone. Good job United

name: Jeff Devine
text: GREAT SERVICE

resp.text: Thanks, Jeff. We appreciate the positive feedback and shout-out for our team. Let us know if we can help out again soon.

name: Angela Wingard
text: Very professional staff. They are always ready to help. The whole team seems to work well together. I love hearing around town how reliable United’s machines are. Great company to help with all your jobs, big or small!
